definition: to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: To perform this task on my own, I must decide how to do it.
sentences.chinese: 要独立完成这项任务，我必须得自己拿主意怎么做。

sentences.english: The issue lies with you. You must decide.
sentences.chinese: 这件事要看你的了，你必须拿主意。

sentences.english: But anyone who paid attention to her self-creation knows that every idea is hers.
sentences.chinese: 而留意的人会发现，她全部全部自己拿主意。

sentences.english: However, before you make that decision try the following exercise to help you to express your anger.
sentences.chinese: 不过，在拿主意前，请做下面的练习来发泄怨气。

sentences.english: I can't make that decision for you; you will have to use your judgement.
sentences.chinese: 我不能代你作决定，你得自己拿主意了。

definition: to decide/to make decisions/to take responsibility (for deciding)/to be in charge/to give sb justice
to do as one sees fit/to play it by ear (according to the circumstances)
to do sth in place of sb else
lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
clapper-board/auctioneer's hammer/to beat time with clappers
to take one's time making a decision (idiom)/to consider at length
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
